question: Briefly discuss two limitations of the family dysfunction explanation for schizophrenia (5 marks):
answer: The answer should refer to at least three of the following points - ethical issues may leave the parents feeling responsible for their child's illness, unreliability of recall leading to data that may lack validity as patients may report childhood experiences retrospectively, impossible to establish cause and effect, family dysfunction may act as a trigger but the cause could be biological

question: Outline and evaluate the use of antipsychotic drugs to treat schizophrenia (3 marks):
answer: The answer should refer to at least eight of the following points - Antipsychotics are drugs used to reduce the intensity of (positive) schizophrenia symptoms, typical antipsychotics are dopamine antagonists and reduce dopamine activity by blocking receptors at the synapse, it has a calming/sedative effect, chlorpromazine is a typical antipsychotic, atypical antipsychotics (such as clozapine and risperidone)block dopamine receptors and act on other neurotransmitters to work on the negative symptoms of schizophrenia, the help suppress psychosis and minimise side effects, clozapine is found to be most effective and acts on serotonin and dopamine receptors, risperidone binds more strongly to dopamine receptors and is thus more effective in smaller doses, both drugs are moderately effective in tackling symptoms, the blocking of D2 receptors can lead to undesirable side effects and can be potentially harmful, patients have an enhances quality of life, economic implications regarding treatment cost
